page.title: 13Farming Around Denmead.
page.content: Agricultural land covers most of the land around Denmead. There are 14 small farms in this area. Many small farms are no longer tenant-owned as most of the landowners live away from their farms while managers run them. Some farms are used now only as houses. Arable farming in this area covers much of the land. Most crops are those that get large E.E.C. subsidies, notably Rape Seed. Wheat is also grown as are vegetables for local markets. Livestock farming on unsown grass is also important especially dairy farming for the local markets. Horses are important as there are several stables in this area. Sheep are also found grazing in this area.
